Today iI am looking at racism in Germany, against Germans with African heritage and for that iI read an interview, with the germanGerman football star and retired national player Jerôme Boateng.
He talks about his experience with racism in the past and nowadays.
Back then, when he was a child, he already experienced a lot racism.
He tells us, that when he was only ten years old, the parents from an enemy football team spit on him and his mates.
At one football game, a father from an enemy player, came to his side and insulted him until he started to cry.
I think this shows how heartless and brutal racism is, he was only a little boy and didn't even know why these mean people offended him.
His parents didn't talked to him about his skin color and why some people have problems with it, until one time someone sayedsaid: Hey, mein kleiner Nigger to him, which means: Hey, my little nigger.
When his parents then told him, that people exist, which have problems with skin color, he couldn't believe it.
He said, that is makes no sense for ana child, and iI think, that is pretty true, because it didn't even makesmake sense for me.
Today he still experiences racism, for example, when he is warming up at the side if the soccer field, some viewers make ape noises, even thothough he achieved so much for and with the German team.
This shows how hard racists reduce people at their skin color or heritage, they don't see the human or his skills, they just see the skin color and they have a problem with it.
Jerôme says that Germany wrestles with itself.
The refugee crisis in Europe is still much discussed in his circle of friends anand colleagues.
There always comes up the same question: What are we doing with all these people and what are the consequences?.

For me, that wouldn't even be a question, it should be clear and standartstandard, that at the first point, you should help the refugees and give them human conditions to live in and then, at the second point, the question, how to proceed with them in the future should be discussed.
Boateng notices, that many people put others in drawers.

One drawer for Germans and one for refugees and even the Germans, which grew up in Germany and just have another skin color are put in an own drawer, even though so many people see every day, what advantages they have, because they are such a mixed country.
For example, the win of the World Cup 2014, wouldn't have been possible for Germany, without all the players with different heritage.
All in all we can see, that racism always was and still is a big problem and not just in Germany.
